page.title: 19SMEATHARPE-SANCTUARY/PRISON?
page.content: Town dwellers usually have a romantic picture of country life. Reality can be rather different. Isolation is a problem for many people living in rural communities. It means that children playing with friends has to be an arranged event. A surprising fact is the high incid- ence of depression and suicide, part- icularly among farmers and their wives. The farmer is under constant stress, worrying about the weather, plus often pressure from the bank. His wife has to cook and wash-up sev- eral times a day when he comes in from the fields. Usually she has to help on the farm as well. In days gone by she would have farm servants, who also provided companionship. The continual grind and the isolation, especially if she cannot drive, can lead to depress- ion.
